body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:

/kind bug

**What happened**:

According to the [documentation for scheduling preemption](https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/) two changes are required to enable it:

* Add `--feature-gates=PodPriority=true` to apiserver and scheduler.
* Add `--runtime-config=scheduling.k8s.io/v1alpha1=true` to apiserver.

So I modified the apiserver manifest:

```
    - --runtime-config=scheduling.k8s.io/v1alpha1=true
    - --feature-gates=PodPriority=true
```

And the scheduler manifest:

```
    - --feature-gates=PodPriority=true
```

`ps` confirms that both are running with the required changes.

However, I cannot create PodPriorities by following the example in the documentation:

```
[root@master-head-1 ~]# cat >example.yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: PriorityClass
metadata:
  name: high-priority
value: 1000000
globalDefault: false
description: "This priority class should be used for XYZ service pods only."
[root@master-head-1 ~]# kubectl apply -f example.yaml 
error: error validating "example.yaml": error validating data: unknown object type schema.GroupVersionKind{Group:"", Version:"v1", Kind:"PriorityClass"}; if you choose to ignore these errors, turn validation off with --validate=false
```

`kubectl explain` also doesn't think the API is enabled:

```
[root@master-head-1 ~]# kubectl explain priorityclass
error: API version: scheduling.k8s.io/v1alpha1 is not supported by the server. Use one of: [apiregistration.k8s.io/v1beta1 extensions/v1beta1 apps/v1beta1 apps/v1beta2 authentication.k8s.io/v1 authentication.k8s.io/v1beta1 authorization.k8s.io/v1 authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1 autoscaling/v1 autoscaling/v2beta1 batch/v1 batch/v1beta1 certificates.k8s.io/v1beta1 networking.k8s.io/v1 policy/v1beta1 rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1beta1 storage.k8s.io/v1 storage.k8s.io/v1beta1 apiextensions.k8s.io/v1beta1 crd.projectcalico.org/v1 v1]
```

The only relevant message in the apiserver log is:

```
I1003 15:06:43.611520       1 aggregator.go:138] Skipping APIService creation for scheduling.k8s.io/v1alpha1
```

**What you expected to happen**:

I expected to be able to create podpriority resources by following the example in the documentation.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:

See description.

**Anything else we need to know?**:

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8", GitVersion:"v1.8.0", GitCommit:"6e937839ac04a38cac63e6a7a306c5d035fe7b0a", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-09-28T22:57:57Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8", GitVersion:"v1.8.0", GitCommit:"6e937839ac04a38cac63e6a7a306c5d035fe7b0a", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2017-09-28T22:46:41Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration**: GCE
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release): CentOS Linux 7.4 (1708)
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`): Linux master-head-1 4.13.4-1.el7.elrepo.x86_64 #1 SMP Wed Sep 27 13:32:23 EDT 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools: Custom scripts
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Scheduling.
labels.name: sig/scheduling

title: scheduling.k8s.io/v1alpha1 cannot be enabled
